page.title: 04Conservation - Clay Area
page.content: Until recently the huge white clay tips would remain barren for many years before any vegetation would grow. The clay industry has now developed new{seeding techniques}which allow the white heaps to be greened in two or three seasons. The tips are contoured by bulldozer into a more natural shape and a mixture of grass seed and clovers is sown.{Soay sheep}from the Western Isles and cross breeds are used to graze the new growth. This improves the vegetation further. Mica is now deposited in lagoons which ultimately can be covered with topsoil. This avoids the{pollution}of rivers and sea which occurred previously.
